page.title: 11Government
page.content: In 1974 Bedlinog was transferred from the Gelligaer U.D.Council to the Merthyr Tydfil Borough Council under the Local Government Act and the Boundary Commision advice.Many people were against such a change but it took place.Also in that year the Bedlinog Community Council was formed.At that time it was the smallest council formed and is named in the Act of Parliament which legislated on this. This Community Councl had five members and its area included Trelewis.In 1979 the council was increased in size from five members to nine members. In 1974 Mid.Glamorgan became the county authority when the old county of Glamorgan was divided into three areas.
